Legal_Issue: Whether the RPD erred in denying refugee status based on conscientious objection and Kurdish ethnicity
Evidence_Type: Applicant's testimony, ethnic background, claim of conscientious objection
Legal_Provision: Section 97 and Section 98 of IRPA, relating to refugee protection and well-founded fear of persecution
Key_Factor_in_Determination: Lack of personalized risk and insufficient proof of genuine beliefs
Proceeding_Type: Administrative hearing followed by judicial review
Regulation_Cited: IRPA, sections related to refugee eligibility and conscientious objectors
Application_Error: Alleged error in assessing credibility and risk
Review_Outcome: No error found; RPD decision upheld
Application_Factor: General risks to Kurds in Turkey not sufficient without individualized risk
Authority: Immigration and Refugee Board (IRB), Federal Court
Governing_Rule_or_Provision: IRPA - definition of Convention refugee, including well-founded fear of persecution
Cause_of_Refusal: Lack of credible evidence supporting genuine conscientious objection and personalized risk
Evidentiary_Issues: Insufficient documentation or corroboration of subjective beliefs
Credibility_Issues: Applicant's claimed beliefs not sufficiently demonstrated
Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Claimant challenged RPD decision via judicial review
Relevant_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act, Charter of Rights and Freedoms (indirectly)
Omission_Type: Failure to provide sufficient evidence of personal risk or sincere beliefs
